creator: Valerie B
title: Dominion Acrostic
quote: If I say, "feed the blue dog, then take it for a walk," "it" refers to the blue dog, including its blueness, but "it" does not mean "the dog you fed." We are talking about a blue dog, and I am giving you two commands concerning it. Feed it, walk it. -Donald X

answers.clue: A secluded river location may be given this status by a Blockade.
answers.explanation: Secluded Shrine and River Shrine can both be set aside by Blockade. If another player gains such a Shrine in their buy phase, they gain a curse, activating Defiled Shrine.
A play on the expression "Monkey See Monkey Do". Monkey is from Seaside.

answers.clue: With only one copy, it can hardly be considered "of plenty".
answers.explanation: The Artifact Horn has only one copy. Reference to Horn of Plenty

answers.clue: Anti-capitalist spiritual awakening.
answers.explanation: The Prophesy Enlightenment turn Treasures played in the Action phase into cantrips. This is the opposite effect of (and a counter to) the Project Capitalism, which turns Action cards into Treasures.

answers.clue: You may do this three times: +3 cards; Put a card from your hand onto your deck.
answers.explanation: A combination of the texts of King's Court and Courtyard.

answers.clue: Needlessly sexy animal.
answers.explanation: Vampire infamously called "needlessly sexy". Vampire is exchanged for Bat

answers.clue: Intriguing source of plagiarism, or a set and its +Buy landscape.
answers.explanation: The original Intrigue 2E box art was partially traced from photos of Renaissance Fair cosplayers. Fair is a Project from Renaissance.

answers.clue: Ruin that initially contains Rising Sun.
answers.explanation: Abandoned Mine initials are AM. The sun rises in the AM (morning).

answers.clue: Animal that makes an Experiment infinitely replicable.
answers.explanation: If Experiment is the Way of the Mouse card, it is not returned to its pile. In real life, experiments can be replicated.

answers.clue: Best Heirloom ever.
answers.explanation: GOAT stands for Greatest of All Time, and is the name of an Heirloom.

answers.clue: Cantrip that rewards desiring skillfully.
answers.explanation: Desiring = Wishing. Skillfully = Well.

answers.clue: Victorious Knight's relation to creator, initially.
answers.explanation: Victorious Knight = Dame Josephine, who is named after Donald X' Significant Other.

answers.clue: Game genre involving Carpenter and Develop.
answers.explanation: The genre of Dominion. Building a physical deck in the yard is a form of carpentry/development.

answers.clue: One could also beg, trade, or conquer to achieve the results of this skill.
answers.explanation: Verb form of Weaver. Weaver, Beggar, Trade, and Conquest can all gain two Silvers.

answers.clue: The Royal Seal variant of choice.
answers.explanation: Treasure that top-decks gained cards (Royal Seal variant). A "choose one" card.

answers.clue: Lackeys, or a magical Loot.
answers.explanation: Staff as in employees, or the Loot.

answers.clue: Field found atop Territory.
answers.explanation: Battle Plan is on top of Territory. Gaining Territory activates Battlefield.

answers.clue: Cursing: fun for all ages!
answers.explanation: Witches are cursers with an age theme (Young/Old Witch)

answers.clue: Originally Roman gods', now nature's.
answers.explanation: When Boons were in Empires, they originally had names like "Jupiter's Gift" before being renamed to stuff like "The Wind's Gift"

answers.clue: Any weak removed card, or a hand full of them
answers.explanation: Weak removed cards are called duds, as is a turn in which you can't do much, which a hand of bad cards would cause.

answers.clue: !____ Philosopher's Stone :its_a_bad_card:
answers.explanation: DomBot Discord command !good . Reacts with :its_a_bad_card: or :its_a_good_card: emotes.

answers.clue: What you say before playing Snowball Fight, or begrudgingly trashing your Snowy Village.
answers.explanation: Snowball Fight comes from the Christmas Kingdom, and is a card that involves physically throwing cards at other players. Lookout may force you to trash a Snowy Village, a card that originally came from the Christmas Kingdom.

answers.clue: Groundskeeper's anachronistic shirt.
answers.explanation: Groundskeeper art is wearing what looks like a T-shirt

answers.clue: Flavorful code word "on the plate."
answers.explanation: Reference to Intrigue flavor text

answers.clue: Same score, same turn count, and nobody starved to death.
answers.explanation: Definition of a tie at game end.

answers.clue: Lover of Zeus, played as Way of the Ox.
answers.explanation: Greek Myth in which she is turned into a cow.

answers.clue: OPT:TYJTO(ISF_);_____,CUT3DNCYHIPAGACOE.
answers.explanation: The first letters of every word of the text of Pilgrimage (credit to JNails for this type of clue)

answers.clue: Missing money-making mat minus sapphire-shaded silver seller.
answers.explanation: Trade Route - Trader = oute

answers.clue: Imperial event that needs no man.
answers.explanation: Event from Empires. Taxman is a removed card.

answers.clue: To curse charity.
answers.explanation: Donate event can be used to get rid of Curses, which do not seem useful for whatever you're donating them to.

answers.clue: +1 Card +1 Action; You may discard a pork product for +1 Answer.
answers.explanation: Text of Hamlet. Hamlet - ham = let

answers.clue: ___CFPICTT.TAETATO(BNA3TIAR).
answers.explanation: The first letters of every word of the text of Journey
